phrases.usage: Use this to start your story about your recent meal.
phrases.example: Yesterday, I ate at a busy Italian restaurant nearby.

phrases.usage: Use this to talk about the food you chose.
phrases.example: I ordered a large cheese pizza and cold orange juice.

phrases.usage: Use this to describe how you liked the meal flavor.
phrases.example: It tasted good because the ingredients were very fresh today.

phrases.usage: Use this when the staff brought your food quickly.
phrases.example: The service was fast so we finished our meal quickly.

phrases.usage: Use this to say the price was quite low.
phrases.example: It was not expensive at all for such delicious food.

phrases.usage: Use this to give the exact price of the meal.
phrases.example: It cost twenty dollars for the entire lunch and drinks.

phrases.usage: Use this to mention the people who were with you.
phrases.example: I went with my best friend from my English class.

phrases.usage: Use this to say what happened after eating there.
phrases.example: Then we walked to the park for some fresh air.

keyVocabulary.definition: Having a very pleasant and good taste.
Costing a lot of money to buy or use.
Moving or happening at a very high speed.
Low in price and not costing much money.
Being kind and helpful to other people around you.
